titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hugo Leander Blomquist papers, 1912-1957
titlestmt.author: Processed by: University Archives Staff; finding aid derived from MARC record using DukeMARC2EAD_ua_record_groups.xsl

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via DukeMARC2EAD_ua_record_groups.xsl November 2014

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Addition contains mostly correspondence between Blomquist and Margaret L. Mordecai (his future wife) dating from 1924-1928. Other letters of note include Blomquist's letters to his brother during his service in World War I, and letters he received from a young girl he met in France during the war. The addition also includes postcards, personal items (passport, smallpox vaccination certificate, honorable discharge), photographs, and journals from his WWI days containing his daily activitives and thoughts containing headings such as: "Impressions of Paris," and "Who won the war?" Materials range in date from 1912-1957. An addition of 0.5 linear feet was added to this accession 15 October 2007. The addition contains primarily letters and clippings. Also present are some photographs and a book of letters presented to Blomquist upon his retirement.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Hugo Leander Blomquist papers, 1912-1957, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Hugo Leander Blomquist was professor and chair of the Botany Department at Duke University from 1921-1957.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Addition contains mostly correspondence between Blomquist and Margaret L. Mordecai (his future wife) dating from 1924-1928. Other letters of note include Blomquist's letters to his brother during his service in World War I, and letters he received from a young girl he met in France during the war. The addition also includes postcards, personal items (passport, smallpox vaccination certificate, honorable discharge), photographs, and journals from his WWI days containing his daily activitives and thoughts containing headings such as: "Impressions of Paris," and "Who won the war?" Materials range in date from 1912-1957. An addition of 0.5 linear feet was added to this accession 15 October 2007. The addition contains primarily letters and clippings. Also present are some photographs and a book of letters presented to Blomquist upon his retirement.
